thread.title: St. John's powerlifter hopes to raise the bar at international competition
thread.title_full: St. John's powerlifter hopes to raise the bar at international competition

author: cbc
title: St. John's powerlifter hopes to raise the bar at international competition
text:
Unlike most people, Maria Htee looks quite comfortable with 170 kilograms (375 pounds) of work-out weights between her shoulders.
In fact, she makes squat lifting the weight look easy.
"I would like to get 400 pounds in a squat and some world records," she said.
That would be well over the current record for her weight class and Htee has three upcoming events to try and reach her goal.
Maria Htee trains, and works, at Goodlife in downtown St. John's (Jeremy Eaton/CBC)
Htee has enjoyed success in her sport in the past few years, winning bronze in 2015 in a competition in Finland.
"At nationals [held in Regina, Sask. in 2016], I won the female lifter award and I am the best female lifter in Canada."
That's not Htee bragging, there's a formula to back that up â€” based on a calculation of body weight and weight lifted.
The Thai-born St. John's-based powerlifter started out in the bikini body competition before switching to the figure category. Then three years ago she started powerlifiting.
Htee has a busy few weeks with events coming up in Ohio, Quebec City and Russia. (Jeremy Eaton/CBC)
Her power with all the weight under the bar is the first thing people notice about her in the gym. The second is her height. Htee stands at 4'11. But don't be fooled by her size.
"Usually people will say that I shouldn't lift that heavy," she said.
"Powerlifting is not about lifting heavy things, you can build yourself up and do a lot of stuff to keep yourself healthy. You don't have to lift heavy to be a powerlifter, just do the compound movement."
Htee has a sponsor who helps out with travel and training and she works at Goodlife in downtown St. John's as a trainer. Right now her sights are set on the Arnold Schwarzenegger Classic in Ohio in the first week of March.
You can see Htee training in the video below.
St. John's powerlifter hopes to lift her way into the record books 2:05
